intro: Achyrocline glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and shrublands. Its leaves are often covered in small, glandular hairs, which may aid in water retention or deter herbivores. The flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the warmer months.
